hanzi-su-wiki:
捨

Значения

Бросать, оставлять, покидать, выбрасывать

Мнемоника

Оставлять 扌 без сожаления, как уходят из жалкой хижины 舎. Знак идентичен 余. Квадрат означает стены.

Варианты

舍

heisig_chinese_memo: Someone stuck their fingers in my cottage cheese (abode)! I'm going to have to abandon the lot!
heisig_constituent: discard, finger, fingers, cottage, little-thatch, umbrella, lidded crock, earthenware jar, soil, dirt, ground, mouth
Keyword_KANJIDIC: discard, throw away, abandon, resign, reject, sacrifice
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: отбрасывать, выбросить, отказаться, уйти в отставку, отклонить жертву
koohiiStory1: Someone stuck their fingers in my cottage cheese! I´m going to have to discard the lot!
koohiiStory2: The wicked witch from Hansel and Gretel only likes the meaty parts of kids. Outside her candy cottage, you can see a pile of discarded fingers.
jp_example_words:
四捨五入(ししゃごにゅう): rounding up (especially fractions)
捨てる(すてる): throw
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you're at your cottage the only thing you do with your fingers is throw away things. The cottage is for vacation. And vacation means being as lazy as possible. But you certainly don't want to live in filth, so you have to throw away your trash at least.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine sitting in your cottage. You throw away a banana peel. You throw away some used sun tan lotion. You throw away all your cares in the world.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The number one thing you throw away while in your cottage is your suit (す). Suits just don't fit the cottage life vibe, man.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Just throw away all your suits when you want to relax. Don't worry about needing one some day, throw it awaaaay!
Ru_Meaning: discard, throw away, abandon, resign, reject, sacrifice
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 拾 (ひろう、シュウ подбирать).

Ru_trainchinese: shě: (глаг) бросать, отказываться от; подавать милостыню, жертвовать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hand (扌) by the house (舎) was thrown away
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Someone stuck their fingers in my cottage cheese (abode)! I'm going to have to abandon the lot!
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand " to the sound of " she ". " House " is " round " words differentiation, expressed down, give up. "Said Wen": "She, Shi Ye. From the hand, she says." Such as "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. Loyalty": "Zhai Renzhi, and Yi Gong to Rongze, kill him, eat his flesh, but give up his liver." "Lun Heng. "Answer Ning": "The gentleman and the villain have different behaviors in their own way, and different choices.

" Shelter " also means giving and giving. "Jade articles. Hand": "Send, give also." Such as "Liang Shu. "To Gai Chuan": "In the beginning, I lived together with my younger brother Qiachang. After Qiachang died, I gave up as a monastery." Southern Song Ye Shi "Guo's Chong Dean Ji": "The big father gives alms and benefits, and the same town relies on."

" She " also said to leave. "Jade articles. "Hand": "Where to give up, go." For example, Han Yu in the Tang Dynasty (Shi Shuang): "Who is willing to give up your sleep when you learn about your relatives in the seat."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " to the sound of " she ". " House " is " round " words differentiation, expressed down, give up.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「舍」聲。「捨」是「舍」的分化字，表示放下、捨棄。《說文》：「捨，釋也。从手，舍聲。」如《呂氏春秋．忠廉》：「翟人至，及懿公於榮澤，殺之，盡食其肉，獨捨其肝。」《論衡．答佞》：「君子與小人，本殊操異行，取捨不同。」

　　「捨」也表示給予、施予。《玉篇．手部》：「捨，施也。」如《梁書．到溉傳》：「初與弟洽常共居一齋，洽卒後，便捨為寺。」南宋葉適〈郭氏種德庵記〉：「大父施捨惠助，一鄉所倚。」

　　「捨」還表示離開。《玉篇．手部》：「捨，去也。」如唐代韓愈〈示爽〉：「座中悉親故，誰肯捨汝眠。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「舍」聲。「捨」是「舍」的分化字，表示放下、捨棄。

she3
HSK 5: 捨,舍
捨捨RS discard, give up willingly, give alms
  • hand 扌 throwing something of the roof 𠆢 of the house 舍
(Simplified: 舍)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 入
Pictophonetic: 扌 (house) indicates the sound; 舍 conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 舍 [ shě ] house, dwelling; to reside, to dwell; to abandon, to give up
①放在一邊；丟開。［合］舍手(放開手；放下手)；舍置(丟開)；舍臉(沉下臉)。
②放棄；捨棄。［合］捨己成人(犧牲自己利益，成全別人)；舍卻(拋開)；捨實求虛(放棄實在的東西，而去追求虛無縹緲的所在)；舍拼(捨棄；不顧一切幹)；舍筏(捨棄渡人的船筏)；舍業(放棄學業；捨棄產業)；捨己芸人(捨棄自己的田地，去耕耘別人的田地。比喻荒廢自己本分內的工作而替他人做事)。
③廢止、停止。［合］舍業(停止學習)。
④佈施，施捨。［合］舍個數(在神佛面前許個願)；舍貧(接濟窮人)；舍宅(施捨住宅作寺院)；舍施(施捨)。
⑤通“赦”。免罪或免罰；釋放。［合］舍禁(解除封山澤的禁令)；舍縱(寬赦，放縱)；舍眼(睜眼；擡眼)。
⑥發，發射。［合］舍拔(發箭)；舍放(發射，放射)。
捨不得 [ shě bu de ]: to hate to do sth; to hate to part with; to begrudge
捨得 [ shě de ]: to be willing to part with sth
捨棄 [ shě qì ]: to give up; to abandon; to abort

四捨五入(ししゃごにゅう): rounding up (especially fractions)
捨てる(すてる): throw

從「 手 」，「 舍 」聲。「 捨 」是「 舍 」的分化字，表示放下、捨棄。《說文》：「捨，釋也。从手，舍聲。」如《呂氏春秋．忠廉》：「翟人至，及懿公於榮澤，殺之，盡食其肉，獨捨其肝。」《論衡．答佞》：「君子與小人，本殊操異行，取捨不同。」 「 捨 」也表示給予、施予。《玉篇．手部》：「捨，施也。」如《梁書．到溉傳》：「初與弟洽常共居一齋，洽卒後，便捨為寺。」南宋葉適〈郭氏種德庵記〉：「大父施捨惠助，一鄉所倚。」 「 捨 」還表示離開。《玉篇．手部》：「捨，去也。」如唐代韓愈〈示爽〉：「座中悉親故，誰肯捨汝眠。」
From the " hand" to the sound of " she". " House" is " round" words differentiation, expressed down, give up. "Said Wen": "She, Shi Ye. From the hand, she says." Such as "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. Loyalty": "Zhai Renzhi, and Yi Gong to Rongze, kill him, eat his flesh, but give up his liver." "Lun Heng. "Answer Ning": "The gentleman and the villain have different behaviors in their own way, and different choices. " Shelter" also means giving and giving. "Jade articles. Hand": "Send, give also." Such as "Liang Shu. "To Gai Chuan": "In the beginning, I lived together with my younger brother Qiachang. After Qiachang died, I gave up as a monastery." Southern Song Ye Shi "Guo's Chong Dean Ji": "The big father gives alms and benefits, and the same town relies on." " She" also said to leave. "Jade articles. "Hand": "Where to give up, go." For example, Han Yu in the Tang Dynasty (Shi Shuang): "Who is willing to give up your sleep when you learn about your relatives in the seat."

捨字的基本解释

捨
shě
见“舍2”。

捨字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shě］
［《廣韻》書冶切，上馬，書。］
(1)舍弃；放下。
(2)离开。
(3)拼；不顾惜。
(4)赦免；释放。
(5)除却。
(6)停留；止息。
(7)施予，布施。
(8)通“舍”。军行一宿。
(9)佛教语。梵文upeks的意译。指心境平静无执着。
(10)姓。明有捨敬。见《江阴县志》卷十三。

捨字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　捨； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页434第35
【唐韻】書冶切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】始野切，?赦上聲。【說文】釋也。【正韻】弃也。【宋書·殷淳傳】愛好文義，未嘗違捨。　又姓。明洪武中，稅課大使捨敬。　經典省作舍。

捨字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

暂无。

Basic explanation of words

shě
See "House 2".
Shed
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [shě]
["Guangyun" book is cut, launched, book. ]
(1) Abandon; let go.
(2) Leave.
(3) Fight; do not hesitate.
(4) Pardon; release.
(5) Except.
(6) Stay; stop.
(7) Giving, giving.
(8) Through "house". One night in the army.
(9) Buddhist language. Paraphrase of Sanskrit upeks. Refers to a calm mind without attachment.
(10) Last name. Ming You She Jing. See Volume XIII of "Jiangyin County Chronicles".

shě
вм. 舍 (бросить, покинуть)
Radicals: 扌, 舎  (fingers, cottage)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you're at your cottage the only thing you do with your fingers is throw away things. The cottage is for vacation. And vacation means being as lazy as possible. But you certainly don't want to live in filth, so you have to throw away your trash at least.
Imagine sitting in your cottage. You throw away a banana peel. You throw away some used sun tan lotion. You throw away all your cares in the world.
Reading Mnemonic
The number one thing you throw away while in your cottage is your suit (す). Suits just don't fit the cottage life vibe, man.
Just throw away all your suits when you want to relax. Don't worry about needing one some day, throw it awaaaay!
